attributes.action: Further safety controls needed on Dyke Vale Road, Sheffield.
attributes.additional_details: Numerous emails have been sent to Sheffield City Council with no avail. They merely reply with political nonsense. Our concerns as residents is that one day there will be a fatalities. As there are two children's parks across the road, this risk is increased further. Please sign our petition so we can pressure Sheffield City Council into taking immediate action.
attributes.background: The residents of Dyke Vale Road in Sheffield have had to tolerate dangerous driving of others for some time. Despite the introduction of a 20mph speed limit, road users continue to greatly exceed this. There has been two near fatal accidents and eight cars written off since October 2015.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:
https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/your-city-council/have-your-say/petitions.html
